title: Blubber
subtitle: A yaml builder for wikibase-docker
prolog_description:
Blubber is a tool, which is supposed to setup your wikibase based on Docker in easy way.

Docker is kind of virtualisation, which encapsulate components or services inside containers. You can get more informations here.

If you want to setup docker now you can use this link.

Also you will need Docker-Composer, which is included in the Docker community edition, so most likely you won't need to install it separately. You can find Docker-Composer here.
components_question: Which components you want to install?
components_elasticsearch_help: Elasticsearch is a vector-space search, which is used for faster search in your wikibase. See here for more
components_wikibaseQuickstatements_help: QuickStatements is a tool to automatically create/update Wikidata items/statements. See here for more
components_wikibaseQueryService_help: Wikidata Query Service is a software package, which provides SPARQL based queries. See here for more
portsConfigurationDescription: Ports are endpoints for the communication between several application. A port is identified by a non negativ number, which is unique. Also there are so called "well known ports", which are addessed by numbers in the range from 0 to 1023, so you cannot use numbers in this range.
wikibaseBlazegraphPort: Which port Blazegraph of Wikibase query service should use?
wikibaseProxyPort: Which port the proxy of Wikibase query service should use?
wikibaseFrontendPort: Which port the user interface of Wikibase query service should use?
quickStatementsConfigurationNamespacePro: Which namespace you want to use for properties in Wikibase?
quickStatementsConfigurationNamespaceIte: Which namespace you want to use for items in Wikibase?
quickStatementsConfigurationPrefixProper: Which prefix you want to use for properties in Wikibase?
quickStatementsConfigurationPrefixItem: Which prefix you want to use for items in Wikibase?

mediawikiAdminName: How would you like to name your MediaWiki admin account?
mediawikiAdminPassword: Provide your admin account a password.

databaseName: How you like to name the database?
databaseUser: What is the name of your database user?
